name: Ace of Wands
meanings: Virility and starting point of enterprises
description: A hand issuing from a cloud grasps a stout wand or club.

name: Two of Wands
description: A tall man looks from a battlemented roof over sea and shore; he holds a globe in his right hand, while a staff in his left rests on the battlement; another is fixed in a ring. The Rose, Cross, and Lily are on the left side.

name: Three of Wands
description: A calm, stately personage, with his back turned, looks from a cliff's edge at ships passing over the sea. Three staves are planted in the ground, and he leans slightly on one of them.

name: Four of Wands
description: From the four great staves planted in the foreground, a large garland is suspended; two female figures uplift nosegays. At their side is a bridge over a moat, leading to an old manorial house.

name: Five of Wands
description: A group of youths brandish staves, as if in sport or strife. It represents mimic warfare and competition.

name: Six of Wands
description: A laurelled horseman bears a staff adorned with a laurel crown; footmen with staves are at his side.

name: Seven of Wands
description: A young man on a craggy eminence brandishes a staff; six other staves are raised towards him from below.

name: Eight of Wands
description: A flight of wands passes over an open country, drawing to the end of their course. Action and progress are imminent.

name: Nine of Wands
description: The figure leans upon his staff with an expectant look, as if awaiting an enemy. Behind him, eight other staves stand erect in orderly disposition.

name: Ten of Wands
description: A man is oppressed by the weight of the ten staves he is carrying.

name: Page of Wands
description: A young man stands in the act of proclamation. He is unknown but faithful, and his tidings are unusual.

name: Knight of Wands
description: He is shown on a journey, armed with a short wand. Though armored, he is not on a warlike errand. The motion of his horse suggests precipitate action or energetic mood.

name: Queen of Wands
meanings: Supportive of men or women depending on context
description: The Wands are always in leaf, symbolizing life and animation. The Queen's personality is magnetic and corresponds to the King emotionally.

name: King of Wands
description: The King is dark, ardent, lithe, animated, impassioned, and noble. He uplifts a flowering wand and wears a cap of maintenance beneath his crown. The lion symbol is emblazoned on his throne.

name: Ace of Wands Reversed
description: A hand issuing from a cloud grasps a stout wand or club.

name: Two of Wands Reversed
description: A tall man looks from a battlemented roof over sea and shore; he holds a globe in his right hand, while a staff in his left rests on the battlement.

name: Three of Wands Reversed
description: A calm personage looks from a cliff's edge at ships passing over the sea, leaning slightly on one of three staves.

name: Four of Wands Reversed
description: From the four great staves, a garland is suspended; two female figures uplift nosegays near a bridge leading to an old manorial house.

name: Five of Wands Reversed
description: A group of youths brandish staves, representing mimic warfare or playful competition.

name: Six of Wands Reversed
description: A laurelled horseman bears a staff adorned with a laurel crown; footmen with staves are at his side.

name: Seven of Wands Reversed
description: A young man on a craggy eminence brandishes a staff; six other staves are raised towards him from below.

name: Eight of Wands Reversed
description: A flight of wands passes over an open country, drawing to the end of their course. Action may be delayed or blocked.

name: Nine of Wands Reversed
description: The figure leans on his staff, appearing vulnerable. Behind him, eight other staves stand erect, forming a palisade.

name: Ten of Wands Reversed
description: A man is oppressed by the weight of the ten staves, though relief or resolution is possible.

name: Page of Wands Reversed
description: A young man stands in the act of proclamation. He is unknown but faithful, and his tidings are uncertain or confusing.

name: Knight of Wands Reversed
description: He is shown on a journey, armed with a short wand. Motion suggests impulsiveness or recklessness, potentially causing disruption.

name: Queen of Wands Reversed
description: The Wands are always in leaf. The Queen’s reversed traits may show conflict, jealousy, or misaligned intentions.

name: King of Wands Reversed
description: The King uplifts a flowering wand, but reversed, his authority may be harsh or misguided. The lion symbol remains on his throne.
